ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Nonorganic hearing loss (Left)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Positive Stenger test and absence of shadow curve (crossover) despite reported total deafness.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Eustachian tube dysfunction / Middle ear pathology (Left)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Excessive negative middle ear pressure (-195 daPa) and history of pain and drainage.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss (Right)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiogram shows flat mild sensorineural hearing loss.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess speech reception and recognition abilities.
To evaluate the validity of the reported unilateral hearing loss.
To assess middle ear function given the history of infection.
To assess the integrity of the auditory pathway.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with mild sensorineural hearing loss in the right ear and reports total deafness in the left ear. However, objective findings—specifically the lack of a shadow curve during unmasked testing and a positive Stenger test—indicate the left-sided loss is nonorganic. Tympanometry reveals excessive negative pressure in the left ear, consistent with the reported history of infection and drainage.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Flat mild SNHL (250-8000 Hz). Left ear: No response, but no crossover (shadow curve) noted without masking.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 25 dB HL, WRS 92%. Left ear: No response.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal. Left ear: Excessive negative pressure (-195 daPa).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ipsilateral normal 500-2k Hz, absent 4k Hz. Left ipsilateral and contralateral absent at all frequencies.
